content.description: Scramble left out of the alcove and onto the currently dirty ledge. Easy climbing past 2 bolts (use alpine runners) leads to the crux bulge. Continue up through more bulges with stances that follow to the anchor.
content.protection: 12 bolts to anchors with Mussy hooks.
content.location:
It is left of

Stachel's Solar Suitcases

. Both start out of the alcove.

content.description: Start near the middle of the cliff off the right side of a small chunk of rock using a right hand sidepull. Head straight up to the ledge left of the juniper, and continue up past the crux to the anchors.
content.protection: 12 bolts to anchors with Mussy hooks.

content.description:
This is the furthest right route at the crag. It sticks with the theme of climbing on this side of the wall. Fun, easy climbing leads to a harder pull through a bulge about halfway up. It shares anchors with

Fiona'd

to the left.
content.protection: 11 bolts to anchors with Mussy hooks.

content.description:
Climb either right or left of the first bolt to a small ledge and to the start of the relatively consistent 5.8 climbing, with two 5.8+ cruxes.

It was named in honor of:

borgenproject.org/solar-suitcase-saves-lives-in-developing-countries/

.
content.location:
Start in an alcove/open book at the bottom of the cliff climber's left and down from "

The League of Extraordinary Bolters

."

content.description:
Ogres and onions have layers, as did this route initially....

Start on the ledge on the right side of the wall. Fun climbing that's never too difficult takes you up to the anchors.
content.protection: 11 bolts to anchors with Mussy hooks.

content.description: Start just right of gully filled with bushes, start on slab aiming for the dihedral to an overhang crux. Save a #3 cam for the overhang. The anchor has Mussy hooks, and yes, the overhang has been climbed at 5.10a.
content.protection: A standard rack to a #3 cam and Mussy equipped anchors.

content.description: Start on a slab with one bolt, and climb to the arete. The dihedral is the crux. There is a tricky move or more powerful, depending on what holds you find.
content.location: It is left of the right right wall.

content.description: Fun climbing off the ground leads to trickier climbing to a small roof which is easier than it looks.
content.protection: 12 bolts to anchors with Mussy hooks.
content.location: It is th e5th route from the right, and it climbs just right of the corner which splits the crag up onto the pillar-like feature.

content.description:
Start up flakes left of

The Madman and the Professor

at a tree and bush. There is a wide crack above - avoid it. Traverse right to the crack to get down. This shares anchors with the sport route. Note: the wide crack above the tree has poor quality rock.
content.location: Is the furthest left route on the wall.

content.description: Climb a slab with a good hold, and balance your way up to the crux below the overhang. This can done be couple of ways. Some people think it’s more like 5.11a.
content.location: It is on the left side of the wall.

content.description: Start near the middle of the wall. Figure out the initial corner, then go through an easier section of climbing to access the upper section. More tricky climbing leads to the anchors.
content.protection: 12 bolts to anchors with Mussy hooks.
content.location: Start on the small ledge below the corner. Look for the belay bolt below the corner.

content.description:
Like it's ogre namesake neighbor, this route has/had layers....

Fun climbing leads up through flakes to a bulge. Layback up and over the bulge, and then head up, trending right to the anchors shared with

Summer Breeze

.
content.protection: 11 bolts to anchors with Mussy hooks.

content.description: Stickclip the first bolt. Thin moves off the ground lead to a stretch of fun but easier climbing. Cryptic crux moves lead to a fun pull through a small roof. Easier but still fun climbing leads to the anchors.
content.protection: 11 bolts to anchors with Mussy hooks.
content.location: It is the 4th route from the right.

content.description:
Start right of

Sunbird

. A hard (jump if you're short) move off the ground leads to the 1st clip. Head up a techy face to the ledge on the right side of the juniper. Easier, but fun climbing leads up the upper face left of the water streak to the anchors.
content.protection: 13 bolts to anchors with Mussy hooks.

content.description:
This route starts around the nose, down and left of the alcove that

Zackimo

and

Stachel's Solar Suitcases

starts. Fun, featured climbing with a variety of moves leads up to a final crux at the anchors.
content.location:
It is between

Shadow Chaser

and

Zackimo

.

content.description: Stickclip first bolt. Hard moves off the ground lead to a short easier section then crux moves to a jug. Fun featured climbing leads to the anchors.
content.protection: 11 bolts to anchors with Mussy hooks.
content.location: It is just left of the corner which spits the crag.
